properties.name: Saint Bonaventure (1872-1883)
properties.description: 1872-1883. Italian. 6th and Spruce Sts.

properties.name: Immaculate Conception (1853-1884)
properties.description: Established 1853. First Location. Moved to Jefferson and Lucas 1872. English-Speaking. Formed from Cathedral parish.

properties.name: Saint Francis Xavier (1841-1884)
properties.description: First location, 1841-1884. English-Speaking. Current location 3628 Lindell Blvd. Territory assumed by Old Cathedral, Saint Patrick, Saint John

properties.name: Immaculate Conception (1884-1902)
properties.description: 1874-1902. Second Location. Moved to Park and Cardinal 1908.

properties.name: Saint Lawrence O'Toole (1855-1948)
properties.description: 1855-1948. Irish. Formed from Saint Patrick parish.

properties.name: Annunciation (1859-1951)
properties.description: 1859-1951. English-speaking. Merged into Saint Mary of Victories

properties.name: Our Lady of Good Counsel (1894-1950)
properties.description: 1894-1950. English-speaking. Formed out of Saint Michael

properties.name: Saint Elizabeth (1873-1951)
properties.description: 1873-1951. Second Location. First location at 14th and Gay Sts. African-American. Parish divided into Saint Malachy, Saint Nicholas, and Saint Bridget

properties.name: Ascension/Saint Paul (1945-2008)
properties.description: Established 1945. Merged with Saint Paul to become Ascension/Saint Paul 1995. Closed 2008. Formed from Saint Paul Pine Lawn. Territory divided among Saint Ann Normandy, Saint Elizabeth Mother of John the Baptist, Our Lady of the Holy Cross

properties.name: Saint Patrick (1981-2012)
properties.description: 1981-2012. Second location of Saint Patrick. First location closed 1973. Final mass 2009, officially suppressed December 31, 2012. Territory merged with Saint Nicholas

properties.name: Saint Columbkille (1872-1952)
properties.description: 1872-1952. English-speaking. Formed out of Saints Mary and Joseph. Appears to have been absorbed into Saint Boniface

properties.name: Saint Casimir (1889-1955)
properties.description: 8th and Mullanphy. 1889-1955. Building razed for highway construction, parish moved to Saint Louis County. Formed out of Saint Stanislaus

properties.name: Our Lady of Czestochowa (1907-1957)
properties.description: 1907-1957. Polish. 317 Victor. Formed out of Saint Stanislaus

properties.name: Saint Stephen of Hungary (1934-1957)
properties.description: 1934-1957. Hungarian. Parish plant closes in 1956, but parishioners still met at Saint Mary of Victories

properties.name: Saint Malachy (1858-1959)
properties.description: 1858-1959. English-speaking. Formed from Saint John, Apostle and Evangelist parish

properties.name: Holy Ghost (1879-1961)
properties.description: 1879-1961. German-speaking

properties.name: Assumption (1861-1964)
properties.description: 1861-1965. English-speaking. Formed from Saint Vincent de Paul

properties.name: Saint Joseph (1916-1969)
properties.description: 1916-1970. Lithuanian

properties.name: Saint Bernard (1874-1973)
properties.description: 1874-1973. German-speaking. Building razed 1973 for highway construction. Formed out of Saint Malachy and Saint Nicholas. 4109 Gratiot St. Saint Louis. Merged with Saint Cronan

properties.name: Saint Patrick (1845-1973)
properties.description: 1843/1845-1973. 6th and Biddle Sts. Irish. First Location. Formed from Old Cathedral parish. Combined with Saint Patrick and Saint Joseph Shrine

properties.name: Our Lady Help of Christians (1900-1975)
properties.description: 1900-1975. Italian. Moved to this location from 19th and Morgan (Delmar) 1902. Became canonical parish in 1935. Combined with Saint Patrick and Saint Joseph Shrine

properties.name: Saint Michael the Archangel (1849-1975)
properties.description: 1849-1975. Irish. Church razed for highway construction 1957. Masses continued in school building until 1975. Formed out of Saint Patrick parish. Partially absorbed into Holy Trinity

properties.name: Saint Henry (1885-1977)
properties.description: 1885-1977. Probably formed from Saint Francis de Sales. Merged to form Immaculate Conception/Saint Henry at I.C. location

properties.name: Sacred Heart of Jesus (1871-1978)
properties.description: 1871-1978. English-speaking. Formed out of Saint Michael and a small portion of Saint Teresa. Absorbed into Saint Augustine

properties.name: Saint Leo (1888-1978)
properties.description: 1888-1978. English-speaking. Formed out of Saint Bridget and Saint Teresa. Closed in late 1960s, merging with Saint Bridget. Reopened as a shrine in 1971 before formally closing in 1978

properties.name: Nativity of Our Lord (1904-1982)
properties.description: 1904-1982. Formed out of Our Lady of Mount Carmel and Saint Ann Normandy. Territory divided between Saint Adalbert and Saint Philip Neri

properties.name: Saint Augustine (1874-1982)
properties.description: 1874-1982. German-speaking. Partially absorbed into Holy Trinity

properties.name: Saint Charles Borromeo (1902-1982)
properties.description: 1902-1982. Locust and 29th. Italian

properties.name: Nativity B.V.M. (1884-1991)
properties.description: 1884-1992. Belgique, MO. Absorbed into Our Lady of Victory - Sereno

properties.name: Saint Liborius (1856-1992)
properties.description: Established 1856. German speaking. Closed 1992. Possibly formed from Holy Trinity and Saint Joseph parishes. Absorbed into Holy Trinity

properties.name: Holy Guardian Angels (1866-1992)
properties.description: 1866-1992. English-speaking. Formed out of Annunciation, Saint Malachy, Saint John, Apostle and Evangelist, and Saint Vincent de Paul. Absorbed into Saint Vincent de Paul

properties.name: Most Holy Name of Jesus (1875-1992)
properties.description: 1875-1992. English-speaking. Formed out of Saint Michael and Saint Teresa. Absorbed into Holy Trinity

properties.name: Our Lady of Perpetual Help (1873-1992)
properties.description: 1873-1994. German-speaking. Apparently formed out of Most Holy Trinity. Also known as Our Lady of Perpetual Succor. Absorbed into Holy Trinity

properties.name: Saint Casimir (1956-1992)
properties.description: 1956-1992. Hathaway Manor, MO. Formed from Saint Jerome Bissell Hills. Absorbed into Saint Christopher Florissant

properties.name: Notre Dame de Lourdes (1902-1992)
properties.description: 1902-1992. Wellston, MO. Possibly formed out of Saint Barbara. Merged with BREM to become Saint Augustine

properties.name: Saint Edward, King (1893-1992)
properties.description: 1893-1992. English-speaking. Formed from Saint Ann Normandy. Merged with Notre Dame, Barbara, Mark, Rose to become Saint Augustine

properties.name: Saint Barbara (1893-1992)
properties.description: 1893-1992. German-speaking. Merged with Notre Dame, Edward, Rose, Mark to become Saint Augustine

properties.name: Saint Rose of Lima (1884-1992)
properties.description: 1884-1992. English-speaking. Formed out of Saint James the Greater and Saint Ann Normandy. Merged with Notre Dame, Barbara, Edward, Mark to become Saint Augustine

properties.name: Saint Mark (1893-1992)
properties.description: 1893-1992. English-speaking. Formed from Visitation, Saint Rose, Saint Cronan, Saint Ann Normandy. Merged with Notre Dame, Barbara, Rose, Edward to become Saint Augustine

properties.name: Saint Ann, Mother B.V.M. (1891-1992)
properties.description: 1891-1992. English-speaking. Originally called Saint Paul, renamed Saint Ann 1896. Formed from Saint Alphonsus. Merged with Visitation to form Visitation/Saint Ann at Visitation location

properties.name: Our Lady of Mount Carmel (1872-1993)
properties.description: 1872-1993. English-speaking. Formed out of Saint Michael, a small piece of Saint Teresa, Saint Ferdinand, and Saint Ann Normandy. Absorbed into Our Lady of the Holy Cross.

properties.name: Saint Agnes (1891-1993)
properties.description: 1891-1993. English-speaking. Formed from Saint Vincent de Paul, Saint Kevin, Assumption. Absorbed into Saint Francis de Sales

properties.name: Saint Adalbert (1912-1993)
properties.description: 1912-1993. Polish. Was a personal parish until 1950, when it became a territorial parish. Merged with Saint Philip Neri to form Simon of Cyrene at Philip Neri location

properties.name: Saint Philip Neri (1919-1993)
properties.description: 1919-1993. Partially formed from Nativity and Saint Engelbert. Merged with Saint Adalbert to form Simon of Cyrene at Philip Neri location

properties.name: Most Holy Rosary (1891-1994)
properties.description: 1891-1994. English-speaking. Merged with Saint Engelbert to form Saint Elizabeth Mother of John the Baptist at Saint Engelbert location

properties.name: Saint Engelbert (1891-1994)
properties.description: 1891-1994. German-speaking. Merged to become Saint Elizabeth Mother of John the Baptist 1994 at Saint Engelbert location.

properties.name: Saint Paul (1909-1995)
properties.description: 1909-1995. Pine Lawn, MO. Merged to form Ascension/Saint Paul at Ascension location

properties.name: Saint Lucy (1957-1999)
properties.description: 1957-1998. Formed from Corpus Christi, Our Lady of Good Counsel, and Saint Sebastian. Absorbed into Corpus Christi

properties.name: Saint Thomas More (1955-1999)
properties.description: 1955-1999. Formed out of Our Lady of the Presentation. Divided into Saint Ann Normandy and Our Lady of the Presentation Overland

properties.name: Saint Louise de Marillac (1934-1999)
properties.description: 1934-1999. Formed from Saint Paul Pine Lawn and Corpus Christi. Absorbed into Corpus Christi

properties.name: Holy Ghost (1923-1999)
properties.description: 1923-1999. Berkeley, MO. Absorbed into Saint Bartholomew

properties.name: Saint Frances Xavier Cabrini (1965-1999)
properties.description: 1965-1999. Formed from Corpus Christi and Saint Sebastian. Absorbed into Corpus Christi

properties.name: Most Blessed Sacrament (1907-2001)
properties.description: 1907-2001. African-American. Formed out of portions of Saint Mark, Saint Edward, Holy Rosary, and Visitation. Absorbed into Saint Elizabeth Mother of John the Baptist

properties.name: Saint Patrick (1939-2001)
properties.description: 1939-2001.Closed in 2001 and reopened as Korean Catholic Church. Parish divided among Our Lady of the Pillar, Saint Richard, Christ the King.

properties.name: Saint Catherine of Siena (1908-2001)
properties.description: 1908-2001. Apparently formed out of All Saints University City and original territory of Notre Dame de Lourdes. Absorbed into Christ the King University City

properties.name: Saint Mary (1851-2001)
properties.description: 1851-2001. Church closed and demolished 2001 for airport expansion. Divided into Saint Blaise, Saint Gregory, Saint Kevin, Saint Lawrence the Martyr.

properties.name: Saint William (1953-2002)
properties.description: 1953-2002. Partially formed from Our Lady of the Presentation. Merged with Saint Gregory and Saint Kevin to form Holy Trinity at the Saint Gregory location

properties.name: Saint Gregory (1942-2002)
properties.description: 1942-2002. Merged with Saint William and Saint Kevin to form Holy Trinity at the Saint Gregory location

properties.name: Saint Kevin (1952-2002)
properties.description: 1952-2002. Merged with Saint William and Saint Gregory to form Holy Trinity at the Saint Gregory location.

properties.name: Saint Timothy (1959-2003)
properties.description: 1959-2003. Lemay/Affton, MO. Formed from Saint George and Mary Queen of the Universe. Merged with Mary Queen of the Universe and Most Precious Blood to form Saint Mark

properties.name: Mary Queen of the Universe (1955-2003)
properties.description: 1955-2003. Formed out of Seven Holy Founders, Saint George, Saint Martin of Tours. Merged with Saint Timothy and Most Precious Blood to form Saint Mark at the Mary Queen of the Universe location

properties.name: Most Precious Blood (1961-2003)
properties.description: 1961-2003. Lemay, MO. Formed from Saint Matthias, Saint Simon, Mary Queen of the Universe and Assumption. Merged with Mary Queen of the Universe and Saint Timothy to form Saint Mark at the Mary Queen of the Universe location

properties.name: Saint Bridget of Erin (1853-2003)
properties.description: 1853-2003. Irish. Formed from Saint Patrick parish. Merged with Saint Teresa to form Saints Teresa and Bridget at Saint Teresa location

properties.name: Saint Teresa of Avila (1865-2003)
properties.description: 1865-2003. English-speaking. Formed out of Saint Bridget and the western area of Sait Michael. Merged with Saint Bridget in 2003, remained at Saint Teresa location.

properties.name: Saint Blaise (1961-2004)
properties.description: 1961-2004. Merged with Saint Lawrence the Martyr to form Holy Spirit at the Saint Blaise location

properties.name: Saint Lawrence the Martyr (1960-2004)
properties.description: 1960-2004. Maryland Heights, MO. Closed 2004 due to airport construction. Merged with Saint Blaise to form Holy Spirit at the Saint Blaise location

properties.name: Simon of Cyrene (1993-2005)
properties.description: 1993-2005. Merger of Saint Adalbert and Saint Philip Neri and Saint Philip Neri location. Parish divided between Our Lady of the Holy Cross and Saint Elizabeth Mother of John the Baptist

properties.name: Our Lady of Loretto (1959-2005)
properties.description: 1959-2005. Spanish Lake, MO. Formed from Saint Aloysius. Merged with Saint Aloysius and part of Transfiguration to form Our Lady of the Rosary at the Our Lady of Loretto location

properties.name: Saint Aloysius (1871-2005)
properties.description: 1871-2005. Mission of Holy Cross 1871-1883, Mission of Our Lady of Mount Carmel 1883-1908. Became parish 1908. Merged with Our Lady of Loretto and part of Transfiguration to form Our Lady of the Rosary at the Our Lady of Loretto location.

properties.name: Transfiguration (1965-2005)
properties.description: 1965-2005. Spanish Lake, MO. Formed from Our Lady of Loretto. Divided between Our Lady of the Rosary and Saint Angela Merici.

properties.name: Our Lady of Good Counsel (1951-2005)
properties.description: 1951-2005. Formed partially from Corpus Christi. Merged with Corpus Christi, Saint Pius X, Saint Catherine of Alexandria, Saint Jerome to form Holy Name of Jesus at the Saint Jerome location

properties.name: Corpus Christi (1915-2005)
properties.description: 1915-2005. Partially formed out of Nativity. Merged with OLGC, Corpus Christi, Saint Pius X, Saint Catherine, Saint Jerome to form Holy Name of Jesus at the Saint Jerome location

properties.name: Saint Pius X (1954-2005)
properties.description: 1954-2005. Merged with OLGC, Corpus Christi, Saint Catherine, Saint Jerome to form Holy Name of Jesus at the Saint Jerome location.

properties.name: Saint Catherine of Alexandria (1921-2005)
properties.description: 1921-2005. Riverview Gardens, MO. Merged with OLGC, Corpus Christi, Saint Pius X, Saint Jerome to form Holy Name of Jesus at the Saint Jerome location

properties.name: Saint Jerome (1952-2005)
properties.description: 1952-2005. Formed partially from Corpus Christi. Merged with OLGC, Corpus Christi, Saint Catherine, Saint Pius X to form Holy Name of Jesus at the Saint Jerome location

properties.name: Saint Thomas the Apostle (1960-2005)
properties.description: 1960-2005. Formed from Our Lady of Fatima and Saint Dismas. Merged with Our Lady of Fatima and Saint Dismas to form Saint Rose Philippine Duchesne at the Saint Dismas location

properties.name: Our Lady of Fatima (1950-2005)
properties.description: 1950-2005. Formed out of Saint Ferdinand, Sacred Heart, Saints John and James, Holy Ghost, Saint Aloysius Spanish Lake. Merged with Saint Thomas the Apostle and Saint Dismas to form Saint Rose Philippine Duchesne at the Saint Dismas location

properties.name: Saint Dismas (1956-2005)
properties.description: 1956-2005. Formed from Sacred Heart Florissant. Merged with Saint Thomas the Apostle and Our Lady of Fatima to form Saint Rose Philippine Duchesne at the Saint Dismas location

properties.name: Saint Bartholomew (1959-2005)
properties.description: 1959-2005. Formed from Holy Ghost, North American Martyrs, and Our Lady of Fatima (possibly also small parts of Saint Mary). Merged with Saints John and James, Good Shepherd, Saint Sebastian, part of Our Lady of Guadalupe to form Blessed Teresa of Calcutta at the Good Shepherd location

properties.name: Saints John and James (1882-2005)
properties.description: 1882-2005. May have been mission of Our Lady of Mount Carmel 1882-1908. Merged with Saint Bart, Good Shepherd, Saint Sebastian, part of Our Lady of Guadalupe to form Blessed Teresa of Calcutta at the Good Shepherd location.

properties.name: Good Shepherd (1958-2005)
properties.description: 1958-2005. Ferguson, MO. Merged with Saint Bart, Saints John and James, Saint Sebastian, and part of Our Lady of Guadalupe to form Blessed Teresa of Calcutta at the Good Shepherd location

properties.name: Saint Sebastian (1953-2005)
properties.description: 1953-2005. Jennings/Ferguson, MO. Formed partially from Corpus Christi. Merged with Saint Bart, Saints John and James, Good Shepherd, and part of Our Lady of Guadalupe to form Blessed Teresa of Calcutta at the Good Shepherd location.

properties.name: Saint Christopher (1967-2005)
properties.description: 1967-2005. Formed from Our Lady of Loretto and Saint Thomas the Apostle. Divided between Blessed Teresa of Calcutta and Saint Angela Merici

properties.name: Saint Hedwig (1904-2005)
properties.description: 1904-2005. Polish. Formed out of Saint Stanislaus and Saint Casimir. Ceased being a Polish parish in 1951. Church and school attendance grew rapidly afterward. Merged into Saint Anthony of Padua

properties.name: Saint Thomas of Aquin (1882-2005)
properties.description: 1882-2005. English-Speaking. Formed from Assumption, Saints Mary and Joseph, and a small piece of Saint Kevin. Territory merged into Saint Pius V, Vietnamese community moved to Resurrection

properties.name: Saint Boniface (1860-2005)
properties.description: 1860-2005. German-speaking. Part of Carondelet until annexation by Saint Louis city in 1870. Prior to establishment German Catholics travelled to Saints Peter and Paul or to Saints Mary and Joseph. Merged into Saint Stephen Protomartyr

properties.name: Saints Mary and Joseph (1821-2005)
properties.description: 1821-2005. English-Speaking. Originally outside of Saint Louis city limits until annexation of Carondelet in 1870. Territory merged into Saint Stephen Protomartyr - currently open as a chapel

properties.name: Holy Family (1898-2005)
properties.description: 1898-2005. German-speaking. Apparently formed out of Saint Aloysius Gonzaga, Saint Bernard, Saint Francis de Sales, Saint Anthony. Merged into Saint John the Baptist

properties.name: Holy Innocents (1893-2005)
properties.description: 1893-2005. English-speaking. Formed out of Saint Cronan. Split between Saint Ambrose and Saint Mary Magdalen

properties.name: Saint Aloysius Gonzaga (1892-2005)
properties.description: 1892-2005. German, later Italian. Merged into Saint Ambrose

properties.name: Our Lady of Mercy (1964-2005)
properties.description: 1964-2005. Formed from Saint Mary Bridgeton and Saint Martin de Porres. Merged into Saint Martin de Porres

properties.name: North American Martyrs (1955-2005)
properties.description: 1955-2005. Merged into Sacred Heart Florissant

properties.name: Saint Stanislaus Kostka (1880-2005)
properties.description: 1880-2005. First Polish Catholic parish in Archdiocese. Suppressed 2005 for reason of schism

properties.name: Immaculate Conception/Saint Henry (1908-2005)
properties.description: 1876-1908 (Saint Kevin). Renamed Immaculate Conception when new church is built 1908. Merged with Saint Henry in 1977 to become Immaculate Conception/Saint Henry. Formed out of Saint Vincent de Paul. Merged into Saint Margaret of Scotland
